title: SF apparel startup putting up billboards with 'alternative facts'
text:

Photo: Betabrand Image 9 of 10 SF apparel company Betabrand, which uses humor in its branding, and social media to sell its clothing, has developed a new line of pants literally called the "gay jean." The denim is woven with multi-colored threads that are exposed after multiple washings, and are representative of the rainbow flag that is a symbol of gay pride. It is a play off the concept of gay gene. less SF apparel company Betabrand, which uses humor in its branding, and social media to sell its clothing, has developed a new line of pants literally called the "gay jean." The denim is woven with multi-colored ... more Photo: Courtesy Of Betabrand SF apparel startup putting up billboards with 'alternative facts' 1 / 10 Back to Gallery 
San Francisco apparel startup Betabrand is tweaking both the president and two larger hometown rivals in an advertising campaign touting "alternative facts." 
The campaign, already on Facebook, goes up on billboards Friday. 
"Another milestone for the company that invented pants. And the wheel," the company said, in a brag worthy of White House spokesman Sean Spicer. 
Betabrand isn't the only company capitalizing on the political climate. In the UK, Dove took out a two-page ad in several newspapers to tout the fictional qualities of its deodorant.
